text:
May 5th
• Getting familiar with Palliative Care Grid Module
Next
• Testing roles and facilities on CARE

May 6th
• Explored user roles and facility configurations within the CARE system
• Testing of role-based access on the Palliative Care module
May 7th
• Discussed with Aravind the issue of appointment scheduling for patients — currently limited to 1 patient per slot; system throws an error when attempting to increase the count.
Next
• Explore the appointment issue and file it if necessary.
• Huddle with Bodhish, Gigin, and Aravind.

8th May
• Reviewed key technical and policy aspects including:
Recognized by the UN as DPG
Care Architecture
MIT licensing
Compliance with ABDM MVP V4 and NRCeS (SNOMED CT terminology)
FHIR-based architecture and full ABDM milestone compliance
Flexible organisational hierarchy and access control for government structures
Plugin architecture (ABDM, HCX, TeleICU, etc.)
9th May
• Social media content plan creation with target personas
• Outlining posts, blogs and Medium article.
Next
Define user personas and generate post ideas accordingly.

May 12th, 2025
• Planning out a scheduler for CARE’s social media posts
• Working on calculating token costs for questionnaires
Next:
Continue with token cost estimation, begin social media post ideation, and design initial templates

May 13, 14
• Call with Dr. Athul and Dr. Mathews regarding NGO and volunteer and secondary unit registration,
• Working on documentation for training modules
• Call with Dr. Mathews about NGO registration
• Gone through product and product knowledge
• Call with Dr. Athul regarding Lab billing
Next
Lab documentation

May 15-16
• Video documentation of NGO facility onboarding and user creation
• Getting familiar with pharmacy operations
• Reported a bug regarding user creation and got it patched.
Next
• Continue video creation of training module
• Continue training module documentation

May 19-22
• Collaborated with @U02D0NA6RHR on preparing the demo instance of Care for the Gates Foundation
• Worked with @U02AP1FDP7T, @U08ERE5FESX to configuration facility, labs, billing, and pharmacy modules.
• Worked with @U08ERE5FESX and @U02D0NA6RHR on adding users and patients to the new demo instance, and verified data accuracy
• Extensively updated docs.ohc.network to include more modules, key concepts and it's details, concept diagrams and high flow diagrams for each modules.
Next:
Continue support for training content, finalize demo walkthroughs

June 2nd
Created job descriptions for the following positions:
• Social Media Intern
• Content Creator Intern
• Data Analytics Intern

June 3rd
• Revised intern JDs
• Issue clarified for Medication Statement in Encounter
Next
• Arike Issue Status Update
• College list preparation for Intern hiring

Haven’t been updating EODs regularly over the last few days, will resume daily updates starting today.
• Collaborated with Aravind and Abhimanyu to sort and update the issue status of Arike.
• Had a call with Rohit and Dr. Athul to document current issues in Arike.
• Visited Sudheendra Hospital and met with Dr. Sachin.
• Created offer letters for interns.
• Learning how to calculate stipends for interns.
• Scribe testing.
• Coordinated with Dr.Athul for medical internship selection process.
• Processed and documented details of selected interns of product documentation, content creation, and engineering.
Next Steps:
• Issue offer letters for Medical and Data Analytics interns.
• Process the next round of intern applications.
• Coordinate with the creative and documentation teams for their initial tasks.
